item.title: Manager, Cards Analytics & Insights
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

The Manager, Cards Analytics & Insights will be a leading contributor in the Analytics & Decision Science team supporting Personal and Business Banking. The Analytics & Decision Science team focuses on creating next generation analytics assets to enable data-driven decision making for partners in Product, Marketing, Client Segment and Strategy. In this role, you will lead analytics engagements to evaluate client behaviours and optimize business decisions related to product, campaign, pricing and other business areas. You will present insights and make data-driven recommendations to senior leaders to help identify opportunities to grow the business and better serve our clients.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Consultant – You integrate domain knowledge with analytical capabilities to deliver value to stakeholders, enable data-driven decision making and proactively identify opportunities to drive business growth (projects/business cases, acquisition/retention campaigns, pricing, channels, segments, products and process enhancements)
  • Analytics – You identify and leverage the right statistical techniques (descriptive, predictive, prescriptive) to extract actionable insights out of client behaviours and business trends (both internal and external).  You appropriately integrate of big data, business intelligence, visualization, self-service and analytical tools into engagements.  You proactively explore new applications of advanced analytics to innovate and build strategic analytics assets.
  • Technology – You leverage big data/analytical tools to analyze large structured and unstructured datasets, build data pipeline and visualization from multiple data sources.
  • Ownership – You think and act like an owner in analytics initiatives ensuring the proper identification and translation of business needs into analytics requirements.
  • Communication – Find the story in data and be flexible in communicating at varying levels of details for the right audience.

Who You Are

  • You have a degree in a quantitative field (i.e. mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics, engineering, physics, business) or equivalent experience. Advanced degree is an asset (i.e. MMA, MBAN, MSc, MA, MBA).
  • You are a problem solver. You have exceptional critical thinking, problem solving and decision making skills with demonstrated ability to independently identify and analyze business problems and recommend solutions.
  • You are proficient in programming languages and have experience using modern big data, analytical and dashboard tools (i.e. SAS, SQL, Python, R, Hadoop, Spark, Alteryx, Tableau, Cognos).
  • You have experience in building end-to-end analytics solutions involving large datasets (i.e. requirement gathering, data extraction, cleaning and transformation, statistical analysis, presentation & implementation).
  • You have working knowledge of statistical techniques (i.e. regression, time-series analysis, clustering, decision trees).
  • You are an avid learner who recognizes the analytics field is constantly evolving. You seek to explore emerging trends and best practices in the industry and are excited to share the knowledge with others.
  • You can be clearly understood. You have very strong communication and presentation skills with a demonstrated ability to clearly and concisely present information to groups and individuals at all levels in the organization.
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-81 Bay, 25th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

Actionable Insights, Advanced Analytics, Big Data, Business Analytics, Business Intelligence (BI), Decision Making, Identifying Opportunities, Presentations, Problem Solving, Process Improvements, Taking Initiative

item.title: Sr. Manager, Cards Analytics & Insights
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

Reporting to the Director, Cards Analytics & Insights the Senior Manager – Cards Analytics & Insights will be a leading contributor in the Analytics & Decision Science team supporting the Cards business within Personal and Business Banking. The Analytics & Decision Science team focuses on creating next generation analytics assets to enable data-driven decision making for partners in Product, Marketing, Client Segment and Strategy. In this role, you will lead analytics engagements to evaluate client behaviours and optimize business decisions related to product, campaign, pricing and other business areas. You will present insights and make data-driven recommendations to senior leaders to help identify opportunities to grow the business and better serve our clients.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Consultant – be a leader in analytics consulting – you will combine analytical work with domain knowledge to deliver value to stakeholders, enable data-driven decision making and proactively identify opportunities to drive business growth.
  • Analytics – identify and leverage the right statistical techniques (descriptive, predictive, prescriptive) to extract actionable insights out of client behaviours and business trends; proactively explore new applications of advanced analytics to innovate and build strategic analytics assets.
  • Technology – leverage big data/analytical tools to analyze large structured and unstructured datasets, build data pipeline and visualization from multiple data sources.
  • Ownership – orchestrate end-to-end delivery of solutions that meet stakeholder requirements and contribute to business success – you will think and act like an owner in analytics initiatives ensuring the proper identification and translation of business needs into analytics requirements.
  • Communication – find the story in data and be flexible in communicating at varying levels of details for the right audience.

Who You Are

  • You have a degree in a quantitative field (i.e. mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics, engineering, physics, business) or equivalent experience. Advanced degree is an asset (i.e. MMA, MBAN, MSc, MA, MBA).
  • You are a problem solver. You have exceptional critical thinking, problem solving and decision making skills with demonstrated ability to independently identify and analyze business problems and recommend solutions.
  • You are proficient in programming languages and have experience using modern big data, analytical and dashboard tools (i.e. SAS, SQL, Python, R, Hadoop, Spark, Alteryx, Tableau, Cognos).
  • You can be clearly understood. You have very strong communication and presentation skills with a demonstrated ability to clearly and concisely present information to groups and individuals at all levels in the organization.
  • You have experience in building end-to-end analytics solutions involving large datasets (i.e. requirement gathering, data extraction, cleaning and transformation, statistical analysis, presentation & implementation).
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • You are an avid learner who recognizes the analytics field is constantly evolving. You seek to explore emerging trends and best practices in the industry and are excited to share the knowledge with others.
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

item.title: Analytics Specialist, Fraud Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

As a Analytics Consultant you will be doing ongoing data analysis associated with rules management within CIBC’s fraud mitigation systems.

You will conduct large data extraction and manipulations using SAS for fraud reporting. As well as, assist the team in the development and application of complex statistical concepts/theories and predictions including cost/benefits analysis, optimization, predictive models  and sampling.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Analytical Thinking –Improve fraud monitoring by responding to fraud trends and mitigate risk surrounding operational processes. Conduct feasibility studies and cost/benefit analysis to clearly depict possible fraud mitigation rule options and recommended courses of action.

  • Data Management – Creation and maintenance of SAS and SQL programs to access a decision support data repository.  Database management/querying, and computer programming/software expertise.

  • Communication Skills–  Excellent verbal and writing skills to effectively articulate ideas and opinions that involve analysis, interpretation, and assessment.

Who You Are

  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.

  • You have a degree/diploma in preferably Mathematics, Statistics, Business or Computer Science Based discipline.

  • You love to learn. You\'re passionate about growing your knowledge, and you know that there is no limit to what you can achieve.

  • You look beyond the moment. You make decisions and take actions that will make a difference today and tomorrow. You proactively seek new opportunities to define what\'s possible.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

item.title: Senior Analyst, Real Estate Secured Lending, Retail Risk Management
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

Provide analytics to support the development of proposals/business cases for credit policy, process, system adjudication rules and account management strategy that will improve real estate secured lending credit risk management performance (e.g. increase system approval rates within acceptable risk boundaries). As the Senior Analyst, Real Estate Secured Lending, Retail Risk Management, you will undertake analytics in support of driving deeper insights into the performance of various segments of the real estate secured portfolios. Work with Risk Managers to design ad-hoc reports and queries, and identify potential risks or opportunities.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Experience – You have knowledge of credit risk management policies, standards and guidelines to enable the completion of various analytical assignments. Experience in real estate secured lending is an asset. You are familiar with Credit Bureau data and its uses in risk strategies or scoring.
  • Analytical – You possess strong analytical and creative problem solving skills with the ability to interpret and analyze information to formulate sound conclusions.
  • Communication – You have the ability to convey technical information in understandable terms, both written and verbal. Effectively prepare and present data and insights to senior executives.
  • Adaptable - You are a proactive self-starter and have flexibility to adapt to an evolving environment with shifting priorities

Who You Are

  • You love to learn. You\'re passionate about growing your knowledge, and you know that there is no limit to what you can achieve.
  • You\'re driven to succeed. You are motivated by accomplishing your goals and delivering your best to make an impact.
  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
  • You can demonstrate experience in – You have experience with data analysis tools and databases (eg. SAS EG, SQL, TRIAD, Decision Manager).
  • You have a degree/diploma in – You have a university degree in Business, Finance, MBA degree or equivalent.  Accounting or Analyst (FRM, CFA) designations, or studies in quantitative discipline such as Engineering, Applied Science/Math or related field is an asset.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

item.title: Consultant, Risk Business Intelligence Office
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

As Consultant of the Risk Business Intelligence Office (RBIO) you’ll apply your Technical skillset and knowledge of Risk Management to enhance risk domain business intelligence. You’ll participate in collaborating with business owners to capture detailed requirements and aid in supporting our technical teams to deliver reporting solutions using the Business Intelligence tools available.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Business Analysis – Work with owners of the various source systems that feed into our central data warehouse. This includes attending regular meetings to discuss new initiatives and planned promotion schedules in order for us to be able to synchronize our system with such upstream changes. In addition, provide support to our BI Developers with business requirements and UAT testing.
  • Collaborate – Work with technology teams that support our systems. They depend on our expertise to provide detailed requirements to implement our initiatives. Strengthen existing mutually beneficial relationships with external teams including the technology team.
  • Project planning and execution - As part of your business intelligence and data management responsibilities, you will participate in managing and tracking various commitments to our clients, helping to ensure that critical deadlines are closely monitored and not compromised.

Who You Are

  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • You demonstrate experience in having a thorough understanding of and extensive experience with data warehouses, data querying tools (SQL), BI Tools (Cognos, Tableau), experience with large data models and preparing data mapping and business requirement documents
  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life.
  • You have a degree in computer science or mathematical studies. Business Analyst Certification is an asset.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

item.title: Consultant, Business Systems Analysis
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You\'ll Be Doing

As a Business Systems Consultant you will be responsible for providing management reporting and business analytics to support IT Senior Management. This includes creating and delivering regular and ad hoc reports as well as conducting analysis to support business decisions and initiatives

How You\'ll Succeed

  • Data Analytics & Reporting: Gather key business metrics that will support management and risk reports on a regular basis. Perform business analysis to support business decisions and initiatives.  Provide Information Governance by maintaining a Metric Dictionary and calendar of key deliverables
  • Understanding and Documenting Requirements - Work closely with business partners to gather complex business requirements and facilitate solution design discussions to ensure you meet project needs. Build strong relationships, lead discussions, listen and ask the right questions to ensure solutions meet requirements.
  • Leading and Mentoring – Support technology project implementation as a data subject matter expert, and provide guidance to a diverse team of technology and project professionals. Maintain a collaborative work environment and support team members to resolve organizational, operational, and process problems.

Who You Are

  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it’s the right thing to do.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • You\'re driven by collective success and your influence makes an impact. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to create a shared vision. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • You have strong business acumen, including 4 to 8 years of working experience, preferably with 2 years of consulting experience. A university degree is required (Engineering, Computer Science or Business preferred) with an MBA being nice to have. A developed working knowledge of the IT industry is essential. Operations Risk experience is an asset.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-CC East 11th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

Agile Methodologies, Change Management, Data Analytics (Inactive), Demonstrating Business Acumen (Inactive), Driving Vision and Purpose (Inactive), ITIL (Inactive), Management Consulting, Managing Relationships (Inactive), Microsoft PowerPoint, Microsoft Project, Microsoft Visio, Microsoft Word, Problem Solving, Taking a Global Perspective (Inactive)

item.title: Azure Developer
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You\'ll Be Doing

You’ll be joining CIBC’s Global Wires and Payments Technology Team. You’ll lead complex projects to design strategic solutions aligned to CIBC’s enterprise architecture roadmap. As a Consultant Application Development, you’ll support end-to-end project implementation and act as a subject matter expert in both business and technology. You’ll ideate and collaborate with a diverse team to create and build flexible, innovative solutions that deliver a best-in-class client experience.

How You\'ll Succeed

  • Solution Design – Build client-focused solutions that meet business requirements. Prepare and validate solution design documents around areas such as scope clarification, solution requirements, and quality assurance. Should be able lead complex design and be a key anchor on the design of web Application on Azure cloud.

  • Leading and Mentoring – Support end-to-end project implementation as a subject matter expert, and provide guidance to a diverse team of technology and project professionals. Maintain a collaborative work environment and support team members to resolve organizational, operational, and process problems.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience in: Software prototyping and construction – Design, Build, and Modify existing business-tier components, Web applications, and database objects using Microsoft platform technologies (ASP.NET Web API) and Azure. Working knowledge of UI frameworks (e.g. VueJS, ReactJS, Angular, etc.) Azure Web App and Azure Function App development and configuration. Azure Key vault interaction. Full Stack Development experience is preferred- C#/.NET Core (strongly preferred), or Node.js. Sound Experience in Object Oriented design. Experience building and  integrating with external systems using SOAP/REST API connectors. Experience in Building REST APIs . Experience working in waterfall and agile based teams and environments. 

  • It is an asset if you have experience in Microsoft SQL server, working knowledge of NoSQL DBs like Cosmos DB or MongoDB. Knowledge of Single Sign on. Knowledge of Azure Disaster recovery for various azure components. Hands on working experience (at least 2+ years) in some of the following technologies:

  • Data - SQL, Azure Data Lake, Data Lake Analytics, Azure Data Factory, Cosmos DB, Storage account

  • Networking-  VNET, VPN, Event Hub, Event Grid, Service Bus

  • Hybrid cloud Virtual Networks, Azure AD Connect, Azure Domain Services

  • Security AD / Azure Active Directory, RBAC/PIM/RMS, Access Review, Key Vault

  • Scripting TypeScript , JavaScript, jQuery, VueJS , Angular, React, Azure CLI, PowerShell

  • You have strong knowledge of: Enterprise Delivery Framework, application governance and controls, delivery with complex technical infrastructure and applications, and experience with Tier 1 critical applications. It is an asset if you have knowledge of DevOps, Agile delivery and an understanding of large value payments and Wires, SWIFT, ISO 20022, LVTS/LYNX

  • You embrace and champion change: You’ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.  You empower and enable your team to make continuous improvement, go above and beyond, and deliver results. You are both a quick learner and adaptable team member.

  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it’s the right thing to do. Occasional weekend / after-hours work may be required to support project implementations, system upgrades and support for production environments

  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.

  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to create a shared vision.

  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.

  • You have a degree/diploma in Computer Science, and/or a related field, and you’ve spent at least 2+ years in a Development lead role leading projects and designing solutions.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program

  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients

  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-483 Bay St;. 8th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills
